title: Vegan Tangerine Bundt Cake
shortDescription: A tangy and delicious slice of tangerine, in the shape of a cake.
description: This cake derived from a lime cake (which is also delcious!), to add variety to my cake repertoire.
directions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente according to package instructions.
While the pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Pecorino Romano, and half of the Parmesan cheese. Season with a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper.
When the pasta is done, reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water, then drain the pasta.
Working quickly, add the hot pasta to the skillet with the pancetta. Toss to combine.
Remove the skillet from heat and pour in the egg and cheese mixture, stirring quickly to create a creamy sauce. If needed, add a splash of the reserved pasta water to loosen the sauce.
Serve immediately with the remaining Parmesan cheese and additional black pepper on top.
